1106                       FRIDAY, JUNE 27, 2003

   No. 02M108. Ricky Earl Brown, Petitioner v. Ivalee Haunani Henry,
Warden. Motion to direct the Clerk to file a petition for writ of certio-
rari out-of-time denied.
   No. 02M106. Ernest Dwayne Jones, Petitioner v. California. Motion
for leave to proceed in forma pauperis without an affidavit of indi-
gency executed by petitioner denied.
   No. 02–182. Georgia, Appellant v. John Ashcroft, Attorney General,
et al. Motion of appellant to dispense with printing the joint appendix
granted.
   No. 02–693. John M. Lamie, Petitioner v. United States Trustee.
Motion of petitioner to dispense with printing the joint appendix
granted.
   No. 02–1774. In Re Fred Riggs, Donna Singer, and Al Dickson, Peti-
tioners. Motion of petitioners to expedite consideration of the petition
for writ of mandamus and/or prohibition denied.
   No. 02–9486. Samuel E. Slagel, Petitioner v. Dennis R. Ruth, et al.
Motion of petitioner for reconsideration of order denying leave to pro-
ceed in forma pauperis denied.
   No. 02–10324. Timothy Philip Regan, Petitioner v. Governing Board
of the Sonora Union High School District, et al. Motion of petitioner
for leave to proceed in forma pauperis denied. Petitioner allowed until
July 18, 2003, within which to pay the docketing fee required by Rule
38(a) and to submit a petition in compliance with Rule 33.1 of the Rules
of this Court.
   No. 02–10638. Francis W. Jaskot, Petitioner v. Anthony J. Principi,
Secretary of Veterans Affairs. Motion of petitioner for leave to proceed
in forma pauperis denied. Petitioner allowed until July 18, 2003,
within which to pay the docketing fee required by Rule 38(a) and to
submit a petition in compliance with Rule 33.1 of the Rules of this
Court.
                    Appeal—Jurisdiction Noted
  No. 02–1580. Richard Vieth, Norma Jean Vieth, and Susan Furey,
Appellants v. Robert C. Jubelirer, President of the Pennsylvania Sen-
ate, et al. Appeal from the United States District Court for the Middle
District of Pennsylvania. In this case probable jurisdiction noted.

   No. 02–626. South Florida Water Management District, Petitioner
v. Miccosukee Tribe of Indians, et al. Motion of Pacific Legal Founda-
tion for leave to file a brief as amicus curiae granted. Motion of Lake
Worth Drainage District, et al., for leave to file a brief as amici curiae
granted. Motion of Florida Fruit and Vegetable Association, et al., for
leave to file a brief as amici curiae granted. Motion of National Water
Resources Association, et al., for leave to file a brief as amici curiae
granted. Motion of City of New York, et al., for leave to file a brief as
amici curiae granted. Petition for writ of certiorari to the United
States Court of Appeals for the Eleventh Circuit granted limited to
Question 1 presented by the petition.

Justice Scalia, Justice Kennedy, Justice Souter, Justice Thomas, Justice
Ginsburg, and Justice Breyer.

                         Certiorari Denied
  No. 03–5943. William Q. Jones, Petitioner v. North Carolina. Appli-
cation for stay of execution of sentence of death presented to The Chief
Justice and by him referred to the Court denied. Petition for writ of
certiorari to the Supreme Court of North Carolina denied.

(JOURNAL)               MONDAY, SEPTEMBER 8, 2003                  1189
SUPREME COURT OF THE UNITED STATES

  Present: Chief Justice Rehnquist, Justice Stevens, Justice O’Connor,
Justice Scalia, Justice Kennedy, Justice Souter, Justice Thomas, Justice
Ginsburg, and Justice Breyer.
  The Chief Justice said:
  “Today we will break for lunch and reconvene at 1:30 and the Court
will be in recess from today until the first Monday in October 2003, at
which time the October 2002 Term of the Court will be adjourned and
the October 2003 Term of the Court will begin as provided by statute.”

                           Oral Argument
   No. 02–1674. Mitch McConnell, United States Senator, et al., Appel-
lants v. Federal Election Commission, et al.;
   No. 02–1675. National Rifle Association, et al., Appellants v. Federal
Election Commission, et al.;
   No. 02–1676. Federal Election Commission, et al., Appellants v.
Mitch McConnell, United States Senator, et al.;
   No. 02–1702. John McCain, United States Senator, et al., Appellants
v. Mitch McConnell, United States Senator, et al.;
   No. 02–1727. Republican National Committee, et al., Appellants v.
Federal Election Commission, et al.;
   No. 02–1733. National Right to Life Committee, Inc., et al., Appel-
lants v. Federal Election Commission, et al.;
   No. 02–1734. American Civil Liberties Union, Appellant v. Federal
Election Commission, et al.;
   No. 02–1740. Victoria Jackson Gray Adams, et al., Appellants v. Fed-
eral Election Commission, et al.;
   No. 02–1747. Ron Paul, United States Congressman, et al., Appel-
lants v. Federal Election Commission, et al.;
   No. 02–1753. California Democratic Party, et al., Appellants v. Fed-
eral Election Commission, et al.;
   No. 02–1755. American Federation of Labor and Congress of Indus-
trial Organizations, et al., Appellants v. Federal Election Commission,
et al.; and
   No. 02–1756. Chamber of Commerce of the United States, et al.,
Appellants v. Federal Election Commission, et al. Four hours allotted
for oral argument. Argued by Mr. Kenneth W. Starr for McConnell,
et al., plaintiffs; by Mr. Bobby R. Burchfield for Political Party plain-
tiffs; by Mr. Theodore B. Olson for Federal defendants; by Mr. Seth
JNL02$0908—09-16-03 07:48:58    JOURNAPGT          MILES




1190                   MONDAY, SEPTEMBER 8, 2003

P. Waxman for Intervenor-defendants; by Mr. Floyd Abrams for
McConnell, et al., plaintiffs; by Mr. Laurence E. Gold for AFL–CIO
plaintiffs; by Mr. Jay A. Sekulow for Echols, et al., plaintiffs; and by
Mr. Paul D. Clement for Federal defendants.


  Adjourned until Monday, October 6, 2003, at 10 o’clock.
